personalStatement.1: My name is Mia and I am a software developer based in Durham. I work for GL Education and I mainly work with Angular and .NET.
personalStatement.2: I studied at The University of Manchester where I completed an undergraduate degree in history, achieving a 2:1, and then moved on to pursue an MSc in Computer Science at Newcastle University where I achieved a distinction.
personalStatement.3: I have since settled in Durham to develop my skills as a software developer. I am very passionate about learning and continually improving my skills wherever I can. I like to take any opportunity to find out something new and interesting and I hope to continue to further my career as a developer, alongside building my own projects in my spare time.
personalStatement.4: If you would like to find out more about my background, you can visit my LinkedIn, Github, or contact me directly at the below links. Thank you for checking out my website!

projects.more: to view my Github profile. See below for some examples.
projects.please-click: For a deeper look into my coding projects, please click

pottery-website.description: Pottery website that I made for my dad. He enjoys pottery in his spare time and in preparation for an exhbition he asked me to create him a website. The requirements were very basic, just somewhere for him to talk about his workshop, show off some of his pots, and link to his Etsy page. This project taught me a lot about hosting a website, as I've used Github pages for my own, but this was my first time buying a domain and hosting through Firebase, so not only did I get to help my dad out, but I also got to learn something new!

PDF-program.description: PDF Reading program. This program was created with Java to read PDFs, save progress, and skip to pages in an interface I can control. I read countless PDFs whilst studying history and was sick of the way they appear in your browser. I wanted to create a simpler way to read them without taking up a tab in my browser and with simple controls.

esperanto-dictionary.description: Esperanto Dictionary. This is a simple Java dictionary program created to quickly lookup words in either Esperanto or English and find its translation. It works from a .txt file so more words can be added and changed at any time.

improved-esperanto-dictionary.description: Esperanto Dictionary 2. This is a full stack dictionary program using Angular, C#, and MySQL. You can quickly lookup words in either Esperanto or English and find its translation. You can also add words to the dictionary through the bottom two fields. I set up the MySQL database on my local machine as a service using DBeaver, and my API makes use of Swagger.
improved-esperanto-dictionary.alt-text: Screenshot of my improved Esperanto Dictionary program

pokemon-red.description: Pokémon Red. This command-line program was created with Python as part of the Code First Girls Intensive Introduction to Python course. The project recreates Pokémon Red as a fully interactive text based game.
pokemon-red.alt-text: Screenshot of opening of Pokemon Red Python command line program

pokemon-database.description: Pokémon Database. This MySQL database was created as part of the Code First Girls Introduction to SQL. The project keeps track of each Pokémon's stats, abilities, evolutions, et cetera, all in a normalised form. It can be used to form Pokémon teams.
pokemon-database.alt-text: Screenshot of the Pokemon Database ER Diagram

ivy-bot.description: Ivy Bot. This is a simple Discord bot, which sends photos of my dog, Ivy, when someone sends a message with the phrase, '!ivy'.
ivy-bot.alt-text: Screenshot of the Ivy Bot Discord bot
